Object Lateral

News / Notes

What's in a Name?

The origin of our namesake

August 24th, 2012

The Proverbs say that a good name is rather to be chosen than great riches, so I was quite excited when I obtained ObjectLateral.com from the gracious guys at [Bocoup][bocoup]. What does it mean? Nothing concrete, that's for sure. It's a combination of [Object Literal][object-literal] (a foundational building block in object-oriented software) and [Lateral thinking][lateral-thinking] (solving problems using creative or indirect approaches). I came up with this name on my own, but I was not the first one. Back in 2009, Rick Waldron and Boaz Sender wrote an entire joke library called ObjectLateral.js after a fortunate typo in the jQuery Conf program (Boaz has the details [here][bocoup-ol-blog]). [bocoup]:http://bocoup.com [object-literal]:http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Object_literal [lateral-thinking]:http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lateral_thinking [bocoup-ol-blog]:http://weblog.bocoup.com/object-lateral-js/
